intro: Elatostema maraiparaiense, commonly known as the Maraiparaiense Elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to South America, specifically found in regions of Brazil and Paraguay. Elatostema maraiparaiense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
